Atorvastatin \u2192 type 2 diabetes.evidence: 2024 Lancet meta-analysis: statins increase diabetes risk 10-36%. FDA label warning since 2012.

Amlodipine/atorvastatin \u2192 type 2 di.evidence: Atorvastatin component causes diabetes. Combination product inherits statin diabetes risk.

Lovastatin \u2192 diabetes mellitus.evidence: Same statin class effect. FDA warning applies to all statins.

Lovastatin \u2192 poorly controlled diab.evidence: Same statin class effect. Worsens glycemic control.

Benazepril \u2192 angioedema.evidence: ACE inhibitors cause angioedema via bradykinin accumulation. FDA black box warning. 0.1-0.7% incidence.

Quinapril \u2192 angioedema.evidence: Same ACE inhibitor class effect. FDA warning.

Liothyronine \u2192 hyperthyroidism.evidence: Liothyronine IS thyroid hormone (T3). Giving T3 to hyperthyroid patients would worsen thyrotoxicosis.

Liothyronine \u2192 Subclinical hyperthy.evidence: Same as above. T3 supplementation contraindicated in ANY form of hyperthyroidism.

Levothyroxine/liothyronine \u2192 hypert.evidence: Thyroid hormone combination for hypothyroidism. CAUSES hyperthyroidism if given to hyperthyroid patients.

Conjugated estrogens \u2192 breast cance.evidence: WHI trial (JAMA 2002): estrogen+progestin increased breast cancer risk by 26%. FDA black box warning.

Dexamethasone \u2192 adrenocortical insu.evidence: Long-acting corticosteroids cause secondary adrenocortical insufficiency via HPA axis suppression.

Methylprednisolone \u2192 adrenocortical.evidence: Same mechanism. Chronic use causes HPA suppression.

Prednisolone \u2192 adrenocortical insuf.evidence: EC indication text says 'Primary or secondary adrenocortical insufficiency'. Prednisolone IS used as replacement therapy for adrenal insufficiency. Our inverse rule is too broad.

Prednisone \u2192 adrenocortical insuffi.evidence: Same as prednisolone. FDA-approved for adrenal insufficiency as replacement therapy. Both cause AND treat it depending on context.

Flecainide \u2192 ventricular tachycardi.evidence: Flecainide IS FDA-approved for life-threatening ventricular arrhythmias (including VT) in patients WITHOUT structural heart disease. CAST trial showed harm only in post-MI patients. EC entry is correct for the narrow indication.

Flecainide \u2192 SVT variants.evidence: Flecainide is FDA-approved for PSVT and sustained VT without structural heart. Our inverse rule covers VT broadly but the narrow indication is valid.

Propafenone \u2192 VT/SVT variants.evidence: Same as flecainide. FDA-approved for SVT and VT without structural heart disease.

Diltiazem \u2192 PSVT.evidence: Diltiazem IS indicated for rate control in SVT. Our inverse rule covers VT, not SVT. This is SVT which is a correct indication.

Ibutilide \u2192 sustained polymorphic V.evidence: Ibutilide converts atrial flutter/fibrillation but can cause polymorphic VT (torsades). The EC entry may be for the antiarrhythmic indication, not the adverse effect.

Milrinone \u2192 catecholaminergic polym.evidence: Milrinone is indicated for acute heart failure. CPVT is a different disease. Our inverse rule may be too broad here.

Verapamil \u2192 heart failure.evidence: Verapamil IS contraindicated in HFrEF (ACC/AHA Class III harm) but can be used in HFpEF and hypertrophic cardiomyopathy-related HF. EC entry may refer to the narrow indication.

Dexamethasone \u2192 pulmonary TB.evidence: Dexamethasone IS used adjunctively in TB meningitis (NEJM 2004). Our inverse rule for extrapulmonary TB is too broad — it includes TB meningitis which is a valid dexamethasone use.

Triamcinolone \u2192 pulmonary TB.evidence: Triamcinolone may be used for TB inflammatory reactions. Our inverse rule is overly broad.
